job_description:
The Senior Data Analyst is a lead individual contributor responsible for collecting, analyzing, and presenting data to improve decision-making across the company. They break down large or complex projects into smaller deliverables that are engaging, easily digestible, and drive meaningful business change. The Senior Data Analyst is skilled at communicating insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value, while also mentoring junior team members and driving adoption of standards and best practices.

The ideal candidate is a proactive, highly technically skilled individual with a passion for leveraging data to address business challenges, uncovering deep insights, and effectively communicating them to drive impactful results. They are able to lead projects across all phases of the lifecycle and work with leadership to influence and define the roadmap.

A day in the life…
• Lead projects across all phases of the lifecycle from problem definition through delivery, owning communication of key deliverables and status to stakeholders
• Define ambiguous projects, break them down into smaller tasks, delegate when appropriate, and guide projects to completion with minimal oversight
• Design, develop, and manage scalable Business Intelligence solutions, encompassing front-end visualizations and robust back-end data infrastructure, to cater to a broad user base and streamline ETL processes
• Partner with key stakeholders to identify problems and collaboratively propose solutions, helping them understand the value that analytics can provide to their domains
• Work with leadership to influence and define roadmap, providing strategic guidance in stakeholder initiative planning
• Mentor junior team members through intentional and proactive guidance, helping design and participate in programs that foster mentorship within and outside the analytics organization
• Elevate the skills of the team through knowledge sharing activities, proactively researching, evaluating, and evangelizing emerging trends and technologies
• Make connections to elevate peers across analytics, including connecting them to documents, technologies, and people to support their work and facilitating opportunities for learning
• Elevate, influence, and drive technical standards across the organization
• Balance competing priorities to focus on the most impactful work, while navigating ambiguity to deliver value across multiple business domains

You own this if you have…
• 1+ years of hands-on development experience with Looker Core, including building explores, views, and LookML models
• Quantitative degree (preferably a Master's or PhD) in mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering, or similar quantitative analytics discipline
• 5+ years of related professional experience in analytics
• 5+ years of experience developing and deploying production-level SQL queries with demonstrated ability to write repeatable and robust code
• 3+ years of experience with advanced BI visualization, including managing complex suites of dashboards with automated monitoring strategies
• Professional experience using R or Python in an analytics capacity with expert knowledge of at least one programming language
• Experience with Conversation Analytics and working with LLMs and AI technologies in an analytical context
• Experience analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations that influence stakeholder decisions
• Experience designing and executing analytical approaches with minimal information, creating and executing clear, results-driven analytical plans
• Demonstrated ability to lead the delivery of high-impact, large-scale data products in production
• Proven ability to conduct complex analytical storytelling, tying together data across different functional areas to answer complex and ambiguous questions
• Familiarity with version control systems (e.g. git) and demonstrated ability to establish and drive coding standards
• Deep understanding of business domains, processes, data sources, and key metrics, with ability to function as expert on data sources within domain
• Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills, with ability to troubleshoot, educate, and convey results to non-experts and experts alike, anticipating stakeholder reactions and effectively landing unpopular or conflicting findings
• Ability to develop strong relationships with a multitude of teams and personnel, investing time in creating and nurturing partnerships with stakeholders

#LI-EB1

job_description:
Gartner is hiring a Senior Data Analyst, Global S&O with 3 - 5 years of experience. Based in United States - Irving, TX and with Hybrid ways of working.

Job description and responsibilities:

Hiring near our Irving, TX, Stamford CT or Fort Myers, FL - Hybrid Work Environment.

Join our dynamic team within Gartner's Global Strategy and Operations (GSO) division, where innovation meets impact. Our Service Analytics & Productivity team is at the forefront of driving automated data solutions across Gartner’s Global Services & Delivery team, leveraging data to uncover new insights and strategies to enhance productivity and boost client retention. This is your chance to be part of a high-impact analytics team dedicated to automation, problem-solving, and stakeholder management, ultimately delivering significant business outcomes.

Key Responsibilities:
• Strategic Collaboration: Partner with business stakeholders to transform strategic needs into actionable automated data insights, driving informed decision-making across the organization.
• Business Intelligence Development: Design, develop, and maintain robust business intelligence solutions using Power BI, ensuring scalability and stability to support evolving business needs.
• Initiative Leadership: Spearhead automation initiatives to streamline data processes, enhancing business efficiency and agility through innovative solutions
• Stakeholder Management: Cultivate strong relationships with stakeholders by effectively communicating automation strategies and priorities, ensuring alignment and understanding.
• Ethical Standards & Teamwork: Uphold the highest ethical standards while fostering a culture of teamwork and collaboration, contributing to a positive and productive work environment.

Requirements and qualifications:

Qualifications:
• Educational Background: 4-6 years of professional experience with a degree in Engineering, Math, Statistics, or related fields.
• Data Visualization Expertise: Mastery of data visualization techniques and tools for impactful storytelling through dashboards, with a primary focus on Power BI.
• Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in Python and essential libraries such as NumPy and Pandas, with a proven track record of creating efficient ETL processes, preferably in Databricks.
• SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation, enabling the creation of innovative data solutions.
• Problem-Solving Skills: A knack for creative problem-solving, with sharp qualitative and quantitative abilities and a keen eye for detail and accuracy.
• Communication Skills: Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to engage with senior leaders and manage multiple stakeholders effectively.
• Microsoft Office Proficiency: Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel and PowerPoint, to support data analysis and presentation.
